messages.title: Renewable Energy
messages.content: We applaud the Council’s first efforts to build solar farms to produce electricity to benefit the people of Telford and Wrekin.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: Will fight any reforms which put healthcare services, like A&E at the Princess Royal Hospital, at risk of privatisation.
Oppose the council's charging policy for adult social care which works to privatise the responsibilities that the council has towards building a network of senior citizen homes.
Want to give more priority to public transport, which is currently treated as an afterthought by the council.
Applaud the council's first efforts to build solar farms to produce electricity to benefit the people of Telford and Wrekin.

NATIONALISE THE RAILWAYS - ABOLISH THE BEDROOM TAX - SCRAP TRIDENT - MOVE POWERS FROM LONDON TO LOCAL AUTHORITIES - INVESTMENT NOT AUSTERITY - BAN FRACKING - LIFT THE MINIMUM WAGE - MAKE A REAL CHANGE.

issues.health: Will fight any reforms which put healthcare services, like A&E at the Princess Royal Hospital, at risk of privatisation.
issues.socialWelfare: Oppose the council's charging policy for adult social care which works to privatise the responsibilities that the council has towards building a network of senior citizen homes.

housing.content: Oppose the council's charging policy for adult social care which works to privatise the responsibilities that the council has towards building a network of senior citizen homes.

leaflet.personalStatement: Tom was born and raised in Madeley and is committed to working with residents to improve land and other issues affecting the area.

politicalExperience.role: Previously sat on Madeley Town Council and worked in libraries across Telford.
politicalExperience.achievements: He currently works in the NHS.

contactInformation.address: Telford and Wrekin Green Party c/o 60 Main Road, Ketley Bank, TF2 0DH

images.caption: Vote Green Party May 7 Peter Hawkins for Telford MP

leaflet.additionalNotes: This publication has not been paid for by taxpayers’ money but has been supported and distributed by Telford and Wrekin Green Party.
